00209 class EGS_CDGEOMETRY_EXPORT EGS_CDGeometry : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00210 
00211 public:
00212 
00213       EGS_CDGeometry(EGS_BaseGeometry *G1, EGS_BaseGeometry **G,
00214             const string &Name = "", int indexing=0) : EGS_BaseGeometry(Name) {
00215           nmax = 0; new_indexing = false;
00216           reg_to_base = 0; local_start = 0;
00217           nbase = G1->regions();
00218           g = new EGS_BaseGeometry* [nbase];
00219           bg = G1; //bg->ref();
00220           for(int j=0; j<nbase; j++) {
00221               g[j] = G[j];
00222               if( g[j] ) {
00223                   //g[j]->ref();
00224                   int n = g[j]->regions(); if( n > nmax ) nmax = n;
00225               }
00226           }
00227           if( !nmax ) nmax = 1;
00228           nreg = nbase*nmax; is_convex = false;
00229           if( indexing ) setUpIndexing();
00230           setHasRhoScaling();
00231       };
00232 
00233       EGS_CDGeometry(EGS_BaseGeometry *G1, const vector<EGS_BaseGeometry *> &G,
00234               const string &Name = "",int indexing=0) : EGS_BaseGeometry(Name) {
00235           if( !G1 ) egsFatal("EGS_CDGeometry: got a null pointer to the"
00236                   " base geometry?\n");
00237           nbase = G1->regions(); new_indexing = false;
00238           reg_to_base = 0; local_start = 0;
00239           if( nbase != G.size() ) egsFatal("EGS_CDGeometry: number of passed"
00240             " geometries (%d) is not the same as the number of regions (%d)\n",
00241             nbase,G.size());
00242           nmax = 0; g = new EGS_BaseGeometry* [nbase]; bg = G1; //bg->ref();
00243           for(int j=0; j<nbase; j++) {
00244               g[j] = G[j];
00245               if( g[j] ) {
00246                   //g[j]->ref();
00247                   int n = g[j]->regions(); if( n > nmax ) nmax = n;
00248               }
00249           }
00250           if( !nmax ) nmax = 1;
00251           nreg = nbase*nmax; is_convex = false;
00252           if( indexing ) setUpIndexing();
00253           setHasRhoScaling();
00254       };
00255 
00256 
00257       ~EGS_CDGeometry() {
00258           for(int j=0; j<nbase; j++) {
00259               if( g[j] ) {
00260                   if( !g[j]->deref() ) delete g[j];
00261               }
00262           }
00263           delete [] g;
00264           if( !bg->deref() ) delete bg;
00265           if( new_indexing ) {
00266               if( reg_to_base ) delete [] reg_to_base;
00267               if( local_start ) delete [] local_start;
00268           }
00269       };
00270 
00271       int medium(int ireg) const {
00272           /*
00273           int ibase = ireg/nmax;
00274           if( g[ibase] ) return g[ibase]->medium(ireg-ibase*nmax);
00275           return bg->medium(ibase);
00276           */
00277           int ibase, ilocal;
00278           if( new_indexing ) {
00279               ibase = reg_to_base[ireg]; ilocal = ireg - local_start[ibase];
00280           }
00281           else {
00282               ibase = ireg/nmax; ilocal = ireg-ibase*nmax;
00283           }
00284           return g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->medium(ilocal) : bg->medium(ibase);
00285       };
00286 
00287       bool isRealRegion(int ireg) const {
00288           if( ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg ) return false;
00289           int ibase, icd;
00290           if( new_indexing ) {
00291               ibase = reg_to_base[ireg]; icd = ireg-local_start[ibase];
00292           }
00293           else { ibase = ireg/nmax; icd = ireg - ibase*nmax; }
00294           return g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->isRealRegion(icd) :
00295                             bg->isRealRegion(ibase);
00296       };
00297 
00298       bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00299           int ibase = bg->isWhere(x);
00300           if( ibase < 0 ) return false;
00301           if( g[ibase] ) return g[ibase]->isInside(x);
00302           return true;
00303       };
00304 
00305       int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00306           int ibase = bg->isWhere(x);
00307           if( ibase < 0 ) return ibase;
00308           int ir = 0;
00309           if( g[ibase] ) {
00310               ir = g[ibase]->isWhere(x);
00311               if( ir < 0 ) return ir;
00312           }
00313           return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + ir : ibase*nmax + ir;
00314       };
00315 
00316       int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) { return isWhere(x); };
00317 
00318       int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
00319                  EGS_Float &t, int *newmed = 0, EGS_Vector *normal = 0) {
00320           if( ireg >= 0 ) {
00321               //
00322               // *** We are inside and ibase is the current base geometry
00323               //     region and icd the local region of the geometry inscribed
00324               //     in ibase (if any)
00325               int ibase, icd;
00326               if( new_indexing ) {
00327                   ibase = reg_to_base[ireg]; icd = ireg-local_start[ibase];
00328               }
00329               else { ibase = ireg/nmax; icd = ireg - ibase*nmax; }
00330               //
00331               // *** See if we will hit a boundary in the base geometry.
00332               //     If we do, newmed and normal will get set accordingly.
00333               //
00334               int ibase_new = bg->howfar(ibase,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00335               if( g[ibase] ) {
00336                   //
00337                   // *** There is another geometry in this base geometry region.
00338                   //     See if will hit one of its boundaries first.
00339                   //
00340                   int icd_new = g[ibase]->howfar(icd,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
00341                   if( icd_new < 0 ) return icd_new;
00342                     // above: yes we do but the new region is outside
00343                     // => we exit the entire geometry. newmed and normal
00344                     // must have been set accordingly.
00345                   if( icd_new != icd )
00346                       return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + icd_new :
00347                                             ibase*nmax + icd_new;
00348                     // above: yes we do and we enter the local region icd_new
00349                     // => calculate the new region and return
00350                     // newmed and normal must have been set in g[ibase]->howfar
00351               }
00352               if( ibase_new != ibase ) {
00353                   // we have entered a new base geometry region.
00354                   if( ibase_new < 0 ) return ibase_new;
00355                   // but this region is outside => just return.
00356                   if( g[ibase_new] ) {
00357                       // there is a geometry in this new base geometry region.
00358                       // are we already inside?
00359                       EGS_Vector tmp(x + u*t);
00360                       int icd_new = g[ibase_new]->isWhere(tmp);
00361                       if( icd_new < 0 ) return icd_new;
00362                         // above: no, we are not => we exit the entire geometry.
00363                         // below: yes, we are in local region icd_new
00364                         // simply calculate the new global region and return
00365                         // newmed and normal have been set in bg->howfar above
00366                       if( newmed ) *newmed = g[ibase_new]->medium(icd_new);
00367                       return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase_new] + icd_new :
00368                                             ibase_new*nmax + icd_new;
00369                   }
00370                   // there is no cd geometry in this base geometry region
00371                   // => simply calculate the new global region and return
00372                   // newmed and normal have been set in bg->howfar above
00373                   return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase_new] : ibase_new*nmax;
00374               }
00375               // new region is the same as old region (i.e. we don't reach
00376               // a boundary => simply return the old region.
00377               return ireg;
00378           }
00379 
00380           //
00381           // *** If here, we are outside.
00382           //     Are we already inside the base geometry ?
00383           //
00384           int ibase = bg->isWhere(x);
00385           EGS_Float tb=0, ttot=0;
00386           bool first_time = true;// first time checking base geometry?
00387           EGS_Vector n; int mednew;
00388           EGS_Vector *pn = normal ? &n : 0;
00389           int *pmednew = newmed ? &mednew : 0;
00390           if( ibase >= 0 ) {
00391               //
00392               // IK Feb 22 2007:
00393               // The following seems flawed. Yes, if there is no inscribed
00394               // geometry we can assume that ibase>=0 is due to roundoff,
00395               // but if there is, we might as well be about to enter this
00396               // geometry (but isInside() thinks that we are already inside).
00397               // What would be the best way to check? Don't know yet.
00398               //
00399               // already inside the base geometry.
00400               // unfortunately, due to roundoff we may think that
00401               // we are inside the base geometry but we are actually
00402               // outside. To make the logic below work, we need to
00403               // check if we are inside the geometry inscribed in region
00404               // ibase.
00405               int icd = g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->isWhere(x) : 0;
00406               if( icd >= 0 ) {
00407 
00408                   // We think we are outside, but isWhere(x) reports that we are
00409                   // inside. This can be caused by numerical roundoff.
00410                   // There are 2 possibilities:
00411                   //   a) The particle has just left geometry, but due to roundoff
00412                   //      we still find it inside for the next step. This possibility
00413                   //      can be checked by checking the distance to the exit point
00414                   //   b) The particle is approaching the geometry but due to roundoff
00415                   //      we already find it inside. This possibility can be checked
00416                   //      by determining the distance to exit point moving along the
00417                   //      direction oposite to the particle direction.
00418                   //***********************************************************************
00419                   // EMH April 12 2013: Check 0 for (b) below was ambiguosly defined as there
00420                   // will be situations where u and -u will not hit the geometry. An univocally
00421                   // defined test is to check whether particle actually enters the geometry from
00422                   // the boundary or a location near it (round-off).
00423                   // REMEMBER: - isWhere will return ir >= 0 when particle seats at a boundary.
00424                   //           - We are here either due to roundoff or just at the boundary
00425                   //
00426                   // 0. Proper check for a and b)
00427                   int ixold = new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + icd :
00428                                              ibase*nmax + icd;
00429                   //EGS_Float tb_neg = 1e30; int ixnew_neg = howfar(ixold,x,u*(-1),tb_neg,0,pn);
00430                   //EGS_Float tb_pos = 1e30; int ixnew_pos = howfar(ixold,x,u,tb_pos,0,pn);
00431                   // Call to CD geometry howfar with updated region ixold. If it is aimed away from
00432                   // geometry, it will return ixnew = -1 and assumption a) was correct. If it is
00433                   // aimed into geometry, it will return ixnew >=0 and assumption b) was correct.
00434                   tb = 1e30; int ixnew = howfar(ixold,x,u,tb,0,pn);
00435                   // Enters geometry and at a boundary or very close to one.
00436                   //if( ixnew_pos >= 0 && ixnew_neg < 0 && tb_neg <= epsilon && tb_pos <= epsilon) {
00437                   if( ixnew >= 0 && tb <= epsilon ) {                            // (b) is true
00438                       t = 0;
00439                       if( newmed ) *newmed = g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->medium(icd) :
00440                                              bg->medium(ibase);
00441                       //if( normal ) *normal = (*pn)*(-1);
00442                       if( normal ) *normal = *pn;
00443                       return ixold;
00444                   }
00445                   else if( ixnew < 0 && tb <= epsilon ){                         // (a) is true
00446                       return ixnew;
00447                   }
00448                   //***********************************************************************
00449 
00450                   // 1. Check if we exit the base geometry after a sufficiently small
00451                   // distance.
00452                   EGS_Float t1=1e30, t2 = 1e30; int ibase_n, ic_n=0;
00453                   ibase_n = bg->howfar(ibase,x,u,t1);
00454                   if( ibase_n < 0 && t1 < 1e-4 ) {
00455                       // Yes we do => we assume that it was a roundoff problem
00456                       // and in reality the particle was outside the base geometry.
00457                       // We then check if it will enter the base geometry.
00458                       EGS_Vector xtmp(x + u*t1); tb = t-t1;
00459                       ibase = bg->howfar(ibase_n,xtmp,u,tb,pmednew,pn);
00460                       if( ibase_n < 0 ) return ibase_n; // no, so just return.
00461                       // yes, so transport to entry point and follow normal outside logic
00462                       tb += t1; ttot = tb; ibase = ibase_n; first_time = false;
00463                       goto do_checks;
00464                   }
00465                   // If here, particle is inside base geometry and also doesn't exit base geometry
00466                   // very soon. So, we must do check 2.:
00467                   // 2. Check if we exit the inscribed geometry after a sufficiently small
00468                   // distance.
00469                   if( g[ibase] ) {
00470                       ic_n = g[ibase]->howfar(icd,x,u,t2);
00471                       if( ic_n < 0 && t2 < 1e-4 ) {
00472                           // Yes we do => we assume that it was a roundoff problem
00473                           // and in reality the particle was outside the inscribed geometry.
00474                           // We move to the boundary and check again the base geometry.
00475                           EGS_Vector xtmp(x + u*t2);
00476                           ibase = bg->isWhere(xtmp);
00477                           if( ibase < 0 ) {
00478                               tb = t - t2;
00479                               ibase = bg->howfar(ibase,xtmp,u,tb,pmednew,pn);
00480                               if( ibase < 0 ) return ibase;
00481                               tb += t2; ttot = tb; first_time = false;
00482                           } else { tb = t2; ttot = tb; }
00483                           goto do_checks;
00484                       }
00485                   }
00486                   if( t1 < 1e-4 && ibase_n >= 0 && g[ibase_n] ) {
00487                       // last resort.
00488                       EGS_Vector xtmp(x + u*t1);
00489                       int icdx = g[ibase_n]->isWhere(xtmp);
00490                       if( icdx < 0 ) {
00491                           tb = t1; ttot = tb; ibase = ibase_n; first_time = true;
00492                           goto do_checks;
00493                       }
00494                   }
00495                   if( t1 > 1e-3 && t2 > 1e-3 ) {
00496                       error_flag = 1;
00497                       egsWarning("EGS_CDGeometry::howfar: ireg<0, but position appears inside\n");
00498                       egsWarning(" name=%s base name=%s inscribed name=%s\n",name.c_str(),
00499                               bg->getName().c_str(),g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->getName().c_str() : "none");
00500                       egsWarning(" x=(%g,%g,%g) u=(%g,%g,%g) ibase=%d icd=%d\n",
00501                               x.x,x.y,x.z,u.x,u.y,u.z,ibase,icd);
00502                       egsWarning(" distance to boundaries: base=(%d,%g) inscribed=(%d,%g)\n",
00503                               ibase_n,t1,ic_n,t2);
00504                   }
00505               }
00506               if( icd >= 0 ) return ireg;
00507               tb = 0; ttot = 0;
00508           } // yes, we are.
00509           else {
00510               // no, we are not. Check if we will enter the base geometry.
00511               first_time = false;
00512               tb = t; ibase = bg->howfar(ireg,x,u,tb,pmednew,pn);
00513               if( ibase < 0 ) return ibase; // no, we will not.
00514               ttot = tb; // i.e. we enter the base geometry after a
00515                          // path-length of tb (wich is less than t).
00516                          // if this happens, newmed and normal are set
00517                          // by the bg->howfar call.
00518           }
00519 
00520 do_checks:
00521           EGS_Vector tmp(x + u*tb);  // position at which we are inside
00522                                      // the base geometry
00523           while(1) {
00524               if( !g[ibase] ) {// no inscribed geometry in this base geometry region
00525                   t = ttot;
00526                   if( newmed ) *newmed = mednew;
00527                   if( normal ) *normal = n;
00528                   return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] : ibase*nmax;
00529               }
00530               // => we have entered.
00531               int icd = -1;
00532               if( !first_time ) {// already howfar-checked base geometry
00533                   icd = g[ibase]->isWhere(tmp);
00534                   if( icd >= 0 ) {
00535                       // already inside of the geometry of this base geometry
00536                       // region.
00537                       t = ttot;
00538                       if( newmed ) *newmed = g[ibase]->medium(icd);
00539                       if( normal ) *normal = n;
00540                       return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + icd :
00541                                             ibase*nmax + icd;
00542                   }
00543                   first_time = false;
00544               }
00545 
00546               // see if we will enter a new base geometry region before t
00547               EGS_Float tnew = t - ttot;
00548               int ibase_new = bg->howfar(ibase,tmp,u,tnew,pmednew,pn);
00549               // see if we will enter the cd geometry of this base geometry
00550               // region.
00551               int icd_new = g[ibase]->howfar(-1,tmp,u,tnew,pmednew,pn);
00552               if( icd_new >= 0 ) {
00553                   // yes, we will.
00554                   t = ttot + tnew;
00555                   if( newmed ) *newmed = mednew;
00556                   if( normal ) *normal = n;
00557                   return new_indexing ? local_start[ibase] + icd_new :
00558                                         ibase*nmax + icd_new;
00559               }
00560               // if the base region is the same or we have exited the
00561               // base geometry, the particle never enters.
00562 
00563               //if( ibase_new == ibase || ibase_new < 0 ) return -1;
00564               if( ibase_new == ibase ) return -1;
00565               if( ibase_new < 0 ) {
00566                   tmp += u*tnew; ttot += tnew; tnew = t - ttot;
00567                   ibase_new = bg->howfar(-1,tmp,u,tnew,pmednew,pn);
00568                   if( ibase_new < 0 ) return -1;
00569                   //tb = tnew; ttot += tnew; first_time = false;
00570                   //goto do_checks;
00571               }
00572               // OK, we are in a new base geometry now, adjust
00573               // position and path-length so-far and retry.
00574               if( tnew < 1e-6 ) tnew = 1e-6;
00575               tmp += u*tnew; ttot += tnew; ibase = ibase_new;
00576               first_time = false;
00577           }
00578       };
00579 
00580       EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00581           if( ireg >= 0 ) {
00582               int ibase, icd;
00583               if( new_indexing ) {
00584                   ibase = reg_to_base[ireg]; icd = ireg - local_start[ibase];
00585               }
00586               else { ibase = ireg/nmax; icd = ireg - ibase*nmax; }
00587               EGS_Float t = bg->hownear(ibase,x);
00588               if( !g[ibase] || t <= 0 ) return t;
00589               EGS_Float t1 = g[ibase]->hownear(icd,x);
00590               return (t1 < t ? t1 : t );
00591           }
00592           int ibase = bg->isWhere(x);
00593           if( ibase < 0 ) {
00594               EGS_Float tt = bg->hownear(ireg,x);
00595               return tt;
00596           }
00597           EGS_Float t = bg->hownear(ibase,x);
00598           if( g[ibase] ) {
00599               EGS_Float t1 = g[ibase]->hownear(-1,x);
00600               if( t1 < t ) t = t1;
00601           }
00602           return t;
00603       };
00604 
00605       int getMaxStep() const {
00606           int nstep = 0;
00607           for(int j=0; j<bg->regions(); ++j) {
00608               if( g[j] ) nstep += g[j]->getMaxStep(); else ++nstep;
00609           }
00610           return nstep + 1;
00611       }
00612 
00613       bool hasBooleanProperty(int ireg, EGS_BPType prop) const {
00614           if( ireg >= 0 && ireg < nreg ) {
00615               int ibase = ireg/nmax;
00616               return g[ibase] ?
00617                   g[ibase]->hasBooleanProperty(ireg - ibase*nmax,prop) :
00618                   bg->hasBooleanProperty(ibase,prop);
00619           }
00620           return false;
00621       };
00622       void setBooleanProperty(EGS_BPType) {
00623           setPropertError("setBooleanProperty()");
00624       };
00625       void addBooleanProperty(int) {
00626           setPropertError("addBooleanProperty()");
00627       };
00628       void setBooleanProperty(EGS_BPType,int,int,int step=1) {
00629           setPropertError("setBooleanProperty()");
00630       };
00631       void addBooleanProperty(int,int,int,int step=1) {
00632           setPropertError("addBooleanProperty()");
00633       };
00634 
00635       const string &getType() const { return type; };
00636 
00637       void  setRelativeRho(int start, int end, EGS_Float rho);
00638       void  setRelativeRho(EGS_Input *);
00639       EGS_Float getRelativeRho(int ireg) const {
00640           if( ireg < 0 || ireg >= nbase*nmax ) return 1;
00641           int ibase = ireg/nmax;
00642           return g[ibase] ? g[ibase]->getRelativeRho(ireg-ibase*nmax) :
00643                             bg->getRelativeRho(ibase);
00644       };
00645 
00646       virtual void getLabelRegions (const string &str, vector<int> &regs);
00647 
00648 protected:
00649 
00650       EGS_BaseGeometry *bg;
00651       EGS_BaseGeometry **g;
00652       int              nbase, nmax;
00653       static string    type;
00654 
00655       /* New indexing style:
00656 
00657          If the base geometry has \f$N_B\f$ regions and the inscribed
00658          geometries \f$G_j\f$ have \f$n_j\f$ regions, then the CD geometry
00659          will have \f$n_1 + n_2 + \cdots n_{N_B}\f$ regions
00660          (if there is no inscribed geometry is some region, then
00661          \f$n_j = 1\f$). Then, for a CD geometry region \f$i\f$
00662          the base region \f$i_B\f$ is given by reg_to_base[i] and
00663          the local region in the inscribed geometry (if any) is
00664          \f$i\f$ - local_start[\f$i_B\f$].
00665        */
00666 
00668       bool             new_indexing;
00671       int              *reg_to_base;
00674       int              *local_start;

00680       void setPropertError(const char *funcname) {
00681           egsFatal("EGS_CDGeometry::%s: don't use this method\n  Define "
00682              "properties in the constituent geometries instead\n");

00684 
00685       void setHasRhoScaling() {
00686           has_rho_scaling = false;
00687           if( bg->hasRhoScaling() ) { has_rho_scaling = true; return; }
00688           for(int j=0; j<nbase; j++) {
00689               if( g[j] ) {
00690                   if(g[j]->hasRhoScaling()) {
00691                       has_rho_scaling = true; return; }
00692               }
00693           }
00694       };
